result.execSummary:
The defendant Shellie M Trevino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Restitution Summary

Defendant Shellie M Trevino in court with attorney Tyler William Wickman.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant Brandi L. Marko in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend charge, will enter plea. and Rest. sum 1136.75 to Northern Lights Service INC, $250.00 fine plus costs, $35 charge. State complied with Victim rights, they returned the form for rest. Def paid $1200.00. This is the agreement of all parties. no threat or force, Know and vol waives rights. Judge is not related to a Gail Anderson. Ct orders will amend charge  to theft of a business setting. PLEAS NC. Found G. State comments no prior record. Atty comments no arrest history. CT orders rest of $1136.75 and $35 service fee and $250 fine plus costs. DNA does not need to be taken because of the date. Atty thinks DNA was taken. if balance is over then the balance gets applied to court costs and that is due within 60days
